metadata.feature_description: Implements lazy loading, caching, and reactive UI updates for optimal performance.

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Test lazy loading of task list

steps.action: Navigate to Settings > Scheduler in PersonaBar
steps.expected: Task list should load on-demand when the Scheduler panel is opened
steps.actual: Task list loaded successfully when navigating to the Scheduler panel. The module was loaded via RequireJS lazy loading mechanism (initializedModules in util.js)

steps.action: Observe the Task Queue tab and wait approximately 35 seconds
steps.expected: Server Time and task data should auto-refresh within the interval
steps.actual: Data auto-refreshed. Server Time changed from 10:06:23 AM to 10:07:08 AM. Task 'Next Start' times updated (Messaging Dispatch changed from 10:06:46 AM to 10:07:52 AM). Time Remaining values also updated correctly.

steps.action: Switch between TASK QUEUE, SCHEDULER, and HISTORY tabs
steps.expected: Tab content should update reactively without page reload
steps.actual: Tab switching was instant and smooth. SCHEDULER tab showed a table view of all tasks with frequency, retry time, and enabled status. HISTORY tab showed execution history with 1,044 records and pagination. Knockout.js bindings rendered data reactively.

steps.expected: History data should render with pagination controls
steps.actual: History tab displayed 'Showing 1-10 of 1,044 results' with functional pagination controls. Task execution details including description, server, duration, success status, and timestamps were displayed correctly.

steps.action: Close the Scheduler panel and navigate to a different section (Dashboard)
steps.actual: Panel closed successfully. Navigated to Dashboard/Site Analytics which showed a different panel.

steps.expected: Scheduler should reload faster due to module caching (initializedModules object)
steps.actual: Scheduler panel reloaded instantly with fresh data. The module was retrieved from cache (initializedModules) and load() method was called instead of full init(). Server Time showed 10:09:36 AM with updated task data.

observations: Code review confirmed lazy loading via RequireJS in util.js - modules are cached in 'initializedModules' object after first load
Auto-refresh mechanism verified - Server Time and task data update automatically without manual refresh
Knockout.js bindings confirmed in main.js with ko.applyBindings() for reactive UI updates
Module caching confirmed - subsequent panel loads use cached modules with load() method instead of init()
LocalStorage caching implemented via panelViewData() function in main.js with key 'DNN_PB_PANEL_VIEW' for persisting panel state
RequireJS configuration includes waitSeconds: 30 and automatic page reload on timeout errors for resilience
